abstract.p: Select Service division of Restaurant Associates wins contract to operate restaurants and food kiosks at $1.2 billion terminal now under construction at Kennedy International Airport (S)

block.p: A division of Restaurant Associates, which owns the Sea Grill at Rockefeller Center and the Brasserie at the Seagram Building, has won a contract to operate the restaurants and food kiosks at the $1.2 billion terminal now under construction at Kennedy International Airport.
The company's Select Service division will oversee 16 restaurants.

A division of Restaurant Associates, which owns the Sea Grill at Rockefeller Center and the Brasserie at the Seagram Building, has won a contract to operate the restaurants and food kiosks at the $1.2 billion terminal now under construction at Kennedy International Airport.
The company's Select Service division will oversee 16 restaurants.

Helen Deknatel, the commercial director for the terminal's developer and operator, JFK IAT, said on Tuesday that the developer had chosen Select Service, a large food company based in Europe, from a half-dozen companies that had sought the food service contract.
